com.j2bugzilla.base

Class BugzillaConnector

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.j2bugzilla.base.BugzillaConnector

  • public class BugzillaConnector
extends Object
    The BugzillaConnector class handles all access to a given Bugzilla installation. The Bugzilla API uses XML-RPC, implemented via the Apache XML-RPC library in this instance.
    Author:
    Tom
    See Also:
    WebService, XML-RPC

    • Method Detail

      • connectTo

        public void connectTo(String host)
               throws ConnectionException
        Use this method to designate a host to connect to. You must call this method before executing any other methods of this object.
        Parameters:
        host - A string pointing to the domain of the Bugzilla installation
        Throws:
        ConnectionException - if a connection cannot be established

      • connectTo

        public void connectTo(String host,
                      String httpUser,
                      String httpPasswd)
               throws ConnectionException
        Use this method to designate a host to connect to. You must call this method before executing any other methods of this object. If httpUser is not null, than the httpUser and the httpPasswd will be used to connect to the bugzilla server. This currently only supports basic http authentication ( @see Basic access authentication). This is not used to login into bugzilla. To authenticate with your specific Bugzilla installation, please see LogIn.
        Parameters:
        host - A string pointing to the domain of the Bugzilla installation
        httpUser - username for an optional Basic access authentication
        httpPasswd - password for an optional Basic access authentication
        Throws:
        ConnectionException - if a connection cannot be established

      • connectTo

        public void connectTo(URL host,
                      String httpUser,
                      String httpPasswd)
        Use this method to designate a host to connect to. You must call this method before executing any other methods of this object. If httpUser is not null, than the httpUser and the httpPasswd will be used to connect to the bugzilla server. This currently only supports basic http authentication ( @see Basic access authentication). This is not used to login into bugzilla. To authenticate with your specific Bugzilla installation, please see LogIn.
        Parameters:
        host - A URL of form http:// + somedomain + /xmlrpc.cgi
        httpUser - username for an optional Basic access authentication
        httpPasswd - password for an optional Basic access authentication

      • executeMethod

        public void executeMethod(BugzillaMethod method)
                   throws BugzillaException
        Allows the API to execute any properly encoded XML-RPC method. If the method completes properly, the BugzillaMethod.setResultMap(Map) method will be called, and the implementation class will provide methods to access any data returned.
        Parameters:
        method - A BugzillaMethod to call on the connected installation
        Throws:
        BugzillaException - If the XML-RPC library returns a fault, a BugzillaException with a descriptive error message for that fault will be thrown.

        public void setToken(String t)
